result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik S Brooks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malik S Brooks in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Malik S Brooks.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf  appeared in court on behalf of Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Asto Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Addendum
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Malik S Brooks not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery and an offer from the state. Further defense advises that the defendant has completed his TAD evaluation, and requests a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. No objections from the state. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Malik S Brooks in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Malik S Brooks in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an order to show cause hearing.  Attorney Jason Findling recently appointed by the SPD's Office.  Defense has not received discovery and requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Matter will be held by Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jason Findling

Defendant Malik S Brooks not in court, defendant in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No attorney has been appointed as yet.  Court adjourned case for Hearing in Br 16.  mn  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed order to withdraw.

Defendant Malik S Brooks in court with Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen via zoom.  Defendant Malik S Brooks in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Defense counsel filed a motion to withdraw.  For reasons stated on the record the court will Grant defense request to withdraw as counsel of record.   The Court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom for Status of Counsel on 6/10/22 at 1:30pm.
Proposed Order received and filed
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel received and filed

Defendant Malik S Brooks in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen; both appear by video.  Defendant Malik S Brooks in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 029963,
Payable Number: 995903,
Amount: $20.00
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Malik S Brooks not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Malik S Brooks in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Malik S Brooks in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malik S Brooks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
